## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been exploring the features of VerusIDs, and I was wondering, are there any limitations to their self-sovereignty, revocability, and recoverability?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, VerusID enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable. There are no limitations in these aspects. VerusIDs are designed to provide users with complete control over their digital identity, data, and assets, while also allowing for revocation and recovery in case of loss or compromise.

**User:**
That's great to know! I've also been looking into Verus Vault, and I was wondering, can it be used for staking without time locking?

**AI Assistant:**
No, Verus Vault is specifically designed for staking-capable time locking and theft prevention. It enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. The time locking feature is an essential part of Verus Vault's design, and it's not possible to use it for staking without time locking.
What are the limitations of VerusID in terms of self-sovereignty, revocability, and recoverability?

Actually, VerusID enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable. There are no limitations in these aspects.

## The Verus testnet, available in the Verus Desktop or cli wallets as the VRSCTEST coin, has the following capabilities, which to our knowledge are unique in crypto today.## Self sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities (currently on mainnet) VerusID
- Enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable.
## Staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault)
- Enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. When locked, a user specifies an unlock delay, typically long enough to notice when someone who might have compromised a user’s keys would have to unlock the ID before spending. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID. Users may also choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID as well. This enables virtually theft proof workflow and a solution to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the 5$ wrench attack, and identity theft. IDs may be used as friendly name cryptocurrency addresses for all currencies on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network. The VerusID protocol is a protocol, which can also be implemented on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
 - Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-ca
